subject: Law
title: Jus Cogens: Non-Derogable Norms
description: A short lesson to help you apply Jus Cogens: Non-Derogable Norms.

hook.text: Two nations sign a treaty allowing slavery. It's void. Some rules in international law can never be overridden.

buildup.text: Jus cogens are peremptory normsâ€”fundamental principles that no treaty or custom can override or derogate from.

discovery.text: Accepted examples: prohibition of genocide, slavery, torture, and aggressive war. These bind all states absolutely.

twist.text: There's no official list. Which norms qualify as jus cogens is debated, and the list evolves slowly over time.

climax.text: Any treaty that conflicts with a jus cogens norm is void from the start. No ratification can save it.

punchline.text: Some rules are so fundamental that no agreement can undo them.

quiz.question: What happens to a treaty that violates a jus cogens norm?
